intro: Schiedeella muscicola, commonly known as the mossy thornapple, is a rare and unique plant species belonging to the family Euphorbiaceae. It is characterized by its distinctive, spiny, and often hairy stems that bear clusters of small, yellowish flowers. The plant produces a milky latex sap, which is a common feature among members of its family. Schiedeella muscicola is typically found in moist, shaded environments, such as forest floors or rocky crevices. Its botanical features make it an interesting subject for ecological and taxonomic studies.
